discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
I will go with D. 

lurker mentions C, but the 'adevertise l2vpn' command is under peering with the spine in the link b44c199 shared. and the link b44c199 shared, D is listed under the vrf context configuration and the exhibit is missing these two commands.

choices.D:
route-target both auto evpn
route-target both auto
choices.B:
address-family I2vpn evpn
route-target both auto
choices.C:
advertise I2vpn evpn
route-target both auto
choices.A:
host-reachability protocol bgp
advertise I2vpn evpn

questions.question_text: Which programming model is vendor-agnostic and combines operational and configuration data in the same container?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
wtf. Cisco literally uses A, C, D interchangeably in a two paragraph explaination of HA and graceful restart. But it seems Cisco leans on the term graceful restart, so should probably be A if I HAVE to choose. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/sw/4_2/nx-os/unicast/configuration/guide/l3_cli_nxos/l3_ospf.html#pgfId-1243342

"High Availability and Graceful Restart"
I will go with NSR on this one D.

questions.question_text:
A network engineer needs to configure a high availability feature for a data center that uses a Cisco Nexus 7700 Series Switch that is configured with dual supervisors. The feature must meet these requirements:

• Network resilience must be ensured
• Network instability for Layer 3 external routing protocols must be reduced
• Neighbors must be notified when the control plane is restarting
• Traffic must still be forwarded to peers while neighbor relationships are restarting

What should be used to meet these requirements?

DRAG DROP -
Drag and drop the configurations from the left onto the correct policies on the right.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

choices.B:
Storage facing port type: Storage port
Fabric interconnect FC mode: Switching
choices.D:
Storage facing port type: Appliance port
Fabric interconnect FC mode: Switching
choices.C:
Storage facing port type: Uplink port
Fabric interconnect FC mode: End-host
choices.A:
Storage facing port type: FCoE storage port
Fabric interconnect FC mode: End-host

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
FIs must be in FC switching mode in order to configure FCOE storage ports so the answer is not A. The best answer is B even though zoning must be configured on the FIs. An appliance port would use a ethernet based storage protocol and not require zoning but this has nothing to do with the FC switch mode. This is a poorly written question.

Selected Answer: A
FCoE storage port: FCoE (Fibre Channel over Ethernet) allows Fibre Channel traffic to be encapsulated into Ethernet frames. This is ideal for environments where the storage array is directly connected to the Fabric Interconnects, and the engineer doesn't want to deal with traditional Fibre Channel zoning.

End-host mode: In this mode, the Fabric Interconnects are configured to treat all connected devices (such as storage arrays) as end-hosts rather than switches. This means the system will not require the configuration of Fibre Channel zoning, since end-host mode eliminates the need for zoning in a traditional Fibre Channel setup.
I'll go with A on this one.

questions.question_text: An engineer deploys a Cisco UCS environment with the storage array directly attached to the Fabric Interconnects. The operations team mandates that the solution must not require the configuration of Fibre Channel zoning. Which configuration set meets these requirements?
